Dead by Daylight‚Äôs inventive concept for a competitive horror game strikes an incredible balance between two very different styles of play, and makes both compelling. Channeling the slasher movie spirit, each match feels like a mini horror movie on both sides. Whether you‚Äôre the efficient and unpredictable killer, or one of the strategically elusive survivors, the thrill of the chase and the ever-present threat that even the best-laid plans can go awry keep Dead by Daylight feeling timely, even after five years of thrill kills. Overall, I think if you really like grinding and famous horror movie killers. This is the game for you!

More then 63 hours with my console time included. This is not the only game of its kind but it is the only one that does it right. This game offers the opportunity to juke the killlers like we all wish the characters in horror films would do. Multiple survivors to choose from each with three unique perks which is great but at the end of the day all play the same. Killer is where the money is! Go on the hunt with the legendary killers of our childhood or one of behaviors originals. Play to sweat or to have fun just do not expect this game to be flawless. Bugs come and go frequentley and if you are playing solo survivor there are some bricks out there. Killer is also punishing to learn at first due to the 4v1 and matchmaking. Highley recommended checking out the content creators for this title as you can spend hundreds of hours in the game and on youtube just watching this game.

Gamer game that gamers play together about killing and ruining other gamers

There are a million reasons not to play this game, you will not have fun, it is an addiction, it is a mixed tactic of gambling to keep you hooked and microtransactions, meaningless levels, and cosmetics to keep your interest beyond the grindathon and relentless bullshit that each match gives you. After years long break from this game, I came back out of curiosity and nothing has changed for the better, unless you count the change to second phase struggling, which is good, but now you can't kill yourself when you're done with this shit. I've been back for 2 days, and every match except for maybe 2 has been people face camping, hook rushing, 3 genning, sandbagging, looping the killer into you, and general toxicity.
I don't think there was ever a time when I wished as much harm, as much travesty, as much horrible shit on my fellow man as when I was playing this fucking meat grinder.
I suppose in a way the game actually does what the lore of the game is pretty well, the entity through tricks and shiny baubles draws unfortunate souls in, just to grind away at their hopes of any enjoyment in this game beyond the fleeting moments of being toxic and ensuring other people are gonna be miserable until eventually it has successfully ground you into nothing to leave the game.

Assymetric gameplay is tough to balance.  DbD does this really well, and with loads of style.  I played this with a few buddies a year or more ago, having discovered it late, and while it wasn't for them, it's stuck with me (113hrs).  The devs did a great job.

i love dead by daylight (the joke is that he's not banned)
Don't waste your time or money on this game.

As a survivor Vaulting over pallets and windows etc. is so clunky not smooth at all extremely frustrating. 

As a killer it seems any interaction besides attacks are spastic. 

Overall the entity dying animation and engaging with the bloodpoints/character editing GUI system in the menu area has a jagged annoying response times they might as well change the name to: "wait for our crappy animations instead of actually play the game by daylight"

It's a great game concept but all these nuisances start adding up. It's only worth playing with mates when there's no other option.
